com.camerontec.util.io

Class BytesSegmentInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • com.camerontec.util.io.BytesSegmentInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class BytesSegmentInputStream
extends InputStream
    Specialization of an java.io.InputStream which uses a BytesSegment as its data source.

    This stream has the capability of being layered on top of different BytesSegment instances without object creation via its wrap(BytesSegment) method.

      • hasRemaining

        public boolean hasRemaining()
        Returns whether there are any bytes immediately available from the stream.

        This is equivalent to: 

           remaining() > 0
        Returns:
        True if there are bytes available in the stream, false otherwise.

      • remaining

        public int remaining()
        Return the number of bytes available in the stream without forcing the caller to catch an exception that can never happen.

        This is equivalent to: 

           available()
        but does not force the caller to catch an exception that can never occur.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes remaining in the stream.

      • readAsOverlay

        public int readAsOverlay(BytesSegment overlaySegment)
                  throws IOException
        Overlay the specified overlay segment over the remaining bytes in the stream.

        This is conceptually equivalent of having the specified overlay segment wrap all available bytes in the stream.

        Parameters:
        overlaySegment - The overlay segment. Must not be null. On return the overlay segments byte array is the same as the stream's underlying byte array, its start position is set to the current position in the stream and its position is the number available bytes remaining in the stream.
        Returns:
        The number of available bytes in the stream, or -1 if no bytes are available.
        Throws:
        IOException - Here only to satisfy the available() contract - should never happen.
